body.p: Which of the following is properly matched with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: Hepatic artery - delivers oxygenated blood to the liver
Hepatic sinusoids - member of the portal triad
Hepatic portal vein - delivers nutrient laden blood from the GI tract.
Hepatic veins - drains deoxygenated blood into the inferior vena cava.

feedback.p: Correct. The hepatic artery does deliver oxygenated blood from the heart to the hepatocytes of the liver.

Incorrect. The hepatic sinusoids are specialized blood vessels between the hepatocytes. The portal triad includes three basic structures, a bile duct, a hepatic artery branch, and a hepatic portal vein branch.
Incorrect. The hepatic portal vein transports absorbed nutrients from the GI tract to the liver.
Incorrect. The hepatic vein returns deoxygenated blood to the heart through the inferior vena cava.
